title: Bhakti Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Devotion
summary: In this chapter, Arjuna asks Krishna to clarify which is better - worship of the formless, impersonal Absolute (Brahman) or devotion to the personal form of God. Krishna explains that while both paths lead to Him, the path of loving devotion (bhakti) is easier and more effective for most people. He describes the qualities of ideal devotees and explains how to cultivate devotion through various spiritual practices. The chapter concludes with Krishna's assurance that His devotees are very dear to Him.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते | ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | evaṁ satatayuktā ye bhaktāstvāṁ paryupāsate | ye cāpyakṣaramavyaktaṁ teṣāṁ ke yogavittamāḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Those devotees who, always steadfast, thus worship You, and those who worship the imperishable, unmanifest—which of them are better versed in yoga?
verses.explanation: Arjuna asks Krishna to compare two types of spiritual aspirants: those who worship the personal form of God and those who meditate on the impersonal, formless Absolute.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते | श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavānuvāca | mayyāveśya mano ye māṁ nityayuktā upāsate | śraddhayā parayopetāste me yuktatamā matāḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me with ever-steadfast devotion, endowed with supreme faith—them I consider most perfect in yoga.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares that devotees who focus their minds on Him with supreme faith are the most perfect yogis.

verses.sanskrit: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते | सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् || संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः | ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||
verses.transliteration: ye tvakṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate | sarvatra-gam acintyaṁ ca kūṭa-stham acalaṁ dhruvam || saṁniyamya indriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥ | te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ ||
verses.translation: But those who worship the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the omnipresent, the inconceivable, the unchanging, the immovable, the eternal—controlling all their senses, even-minded everywhere, engaged in the welfare of all beings—they also attain Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna acknowledges that those who worship the impersonal Absolute with proper discipline and universal goodwill also attain Him, though this path is more difficult.

verses.transliteration: kleśo'dhikatara steṣām avyaktāsakta-cetasām | avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate ||
verses.translation: Greater is the trouble of those whose minds are set on the unmanifest, for the goal of the unmanifest is very difficult for the embodied to reach.
verses.explanation: Krishna explains that focusing on the impersonal Absolute is more difficult for embodied beings because the mind naturally seeks form.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः | अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते || तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् | भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ||
verses.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-parāḥ | ananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsate || teṣām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛtyu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt | bhavāmi na cirāt pārtha mayy āveśita-cetasām ||
verses.translation: But those who worship Me, surrendering all actions to Me and regarding Me as the supreme goal, meditating on Me with exclusive devotion—for them whose consciousness is absorbed in Me, I swiftly become the deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.
verses.explanation: Krishna promises quick liberation to those who surrender completely to Him with undivided devotion.

verses.sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय | निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ||
verses.transliteration: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśaya | nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na saṁśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Fix your mind on Me alone, place your intellect in Me, and you will dwell in Me hereafter without doubt.
verses.explanation: Krishna gives direct instructions for attaining Him by focusing one's mind and intelligence on Him.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च | निर्ममो निरहंकारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी || सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः | मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī || santuṣṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛḍha-niścayaḥ | mayy arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: He who hates no being, who is friendly and compassionate to all, who is free from attachment and egoism, balanced in pleasure and pain, and forgiving... Ever content, steady in meditation, self-controlled, possessed of firm conviction, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me—he who is thus devoted to Me is dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the qualities that make a devotee dear to Him, emphasizing universal goodwill, equanimity, and spiritual discipline.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः | हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ | harṣāmarṣa-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: He by whom the world is not agitated and who cannot be agitated by the world, who is free from joy, envy, fear and anxiety—he is dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna values devotees who remain undisturbed by worldly reactions and who don't disturb others.

verses.sanskrit: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः | सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: anapekṣaḥ śucir dakṣa udāsīno gata-vyathaḥ | sarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: He who is free from wants, pure, expert, unconcerned, and free from all pains, who renounces all undertakings for results—such a devotee is dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the ideal devotee as self-sufficient, pure, skilled, detached, and free from material motivations.

verses.sanskrit: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः || तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् | अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ||
verses.transliteration: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ | śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥ || tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit | aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ ||
verses.translation: He who is equal to friend and foe, equipoised in honor and dishonor, heat and cold, happiness and distress, free from all attachment... He who is indifferent to censure and praise, silent, content with anything, homeless, steady-minded, full of devotion—such a man is dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna continues describing His ideal devotee as one who maintains perfect equanimity in all circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते | श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ||
verses.transliteration: ye tu dharmy amṛtam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsate | śraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ ||
verses.translation: But those devotees who with faith follow this immortal dharma as described, who are intent on Me as the supreme goal—they are exceedingly dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna concludes by declaring that devotees who faithfully follow this path of devotion are most dear to Him.
